com.cloudera.oryx.als.serving

Interface RescorerProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRescorerProvider, MultiRescorerProvider

    public interface RescorerProvider

    Implementations of this interface provide, optionally, objects that can be used to modify and influence the results of:

    • ServerRecommender.recommend(String, int)
    • ServerRecommender.recommendToMany(String[], int, boolean, Rescorer)
    • ServerRecommender.recommendToAnonymous(String[], int, Rescorer)
    • ServerRecommender.mostSimilarItems(String, int, PairRescorer)

    It is a means to inject business logic into the results of ServerRecommender.

    Implementations of this class are factories. An implementation creates and configures an Rescorer rescoring object and returns it for use in the context of one ServerRecommender.recommend(String, int, Rescorer) method call. (A Rescorer&lt;LongPair&gt; is used for ServerRecommender.mostSimilarItems(String, int, PairRescorer) since it operates on item ID pairs, but is otherwise analogous.) The Rescorer then filters the candidates recommendations or most similar items by item ID (Rescorer.isFiltered(String)) or modifies the scores of item candidates that are not filtered (Rescorer.rescore(String, double)) based on the item ID and original score.

    The factory methods, like getRecommendRescorer(String[], OryxRecommender, String...), take optional String arguments. These are passed from the REST API, as a String, from URL parameter rescorerParams. The implementation may need this information to initialize its rescoring logic for the request. For example, the argument may be the user's current location, used to filter results by location.

    For example, a request containing ...?rescorerParams=xxx,yyy,zzz will result in an args parameter with one elements, xxx,yyy,zzz. A request containing ...?rescorerParams=xxx&...rescorerParams=yyy&...rescorerParams=zzz... will result in an args parameter with 3 elements, xxx, yyy, zzz.

    Author:
    Sean Owen
    See Also:
    MultiRescorer, CandidateFilter

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Rescorer getMostPopularItemsRescorer(OryxRecommender recommender, String... args) 
      PairRescorer getMostSimilarItemsRescorer(OryxRecommender recommender, String... args) 
      Rescorer getRecommendRescorer(String[] userIDs, OryxRecommender recommender, String... args) 
      Rescorer getRecommendToAnonymousRescorer(String[] itemIDs, OryxRecommender recommender, String... args) 

    • Method Detail

      • getRecommendRescorer

        Rescorer getRecommendRescorer(String[] userIDs,
                            OryxRecommender recommender,
                            String... args)
        Parameters:
        userIDs - user(s) for which recommendations are being made, which may be needed in the rescoring logic.
        recommender - the recommender instance that is rescoring results
        args - arguments, if any, that should be used when making the Rescorer. This is additional information from the request that may be necessary to its logic, like current location. What it means is up to the implementation.
        Returns:
        Rescorer to use with ServerRecommender.recommend(String, int, Rescorer) or null if none should be used. The resulting Rescorer will be passed each candidate item ID to Rescorer.isFiltered(String), and each non-filtered candidate with its original score to Rescorer.rescore(String, double)

      • getRecommendToAnonymousRescorer

        Rescorer getRecommendToAnonymousRescorer(String[] itemIDs,
                                       OryxRecommender recommender,
                                       String... args)
        Parameters:
        itemIDs - items that the anonymous user is associated to
        recommender - the recommender instance that is rescoring results
        args - arguments, if any, that should be used when making the Rescorer. This is additional information from the request that may be necessary to its logic, like current location. What it means is up to the implementation.
        Returns:
        Rescorer to use with ServerRecommender.recommendToAnonymous(String[], int, Rescorer) or null if none should be used. The resulting Rescorer will be passed each candidate item ID to Rescorer.isFiltered(String), and each non-filtered candidate with its original score to Rescorer.rescore(String, double)

      • getMostPopularItemsRescorer

        Rescorer getMostPopularItemsRescorer(OryxRecommender recommender,
                                   String... args)
        Parameters:
        recommender - the recommender instance that is rescoring results
        args - arguments, if any, that should be used when making the Rescorer. This is additional information from the request that may be necessary to its logic, like current location. What it means is up to the implementation.
        Returns:
        Rescorer to use with ServerRecommender.mostPopularItems(int, Rescorer) or null if none should be used.

      • getMostSimilarItemsRescorer

        PairRescorer getMostSimilarItemsRescorer(OryxRecommender recommender,
                                       String... args)
        Parameters:
        recommender - the recommender instance that is rescoring results
        args - arguments, if any, that should be used when making the Rescorer. This is additional information from the request that may be necessary to its logic, like current location. What it means is up to the implementation.
        Returns:
        PairRescorer to use with ServerRecommender.mostSimilarItems(String[], int, PairRescorer) or null if none should be used. The PairRescorer will be passed, to its PairRescorer.isFiltered(String, String) method, the candidate item ID and item ID passed in the user query as its second element. Each non-filtered pair is passed with its original score to PairRescorer.rescore(String, String, double)
